Description: Handle-plate sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery column-krater; traces of white slip; on top: double tendril motif with lotus bud at centre; edges of handle plate black; underside reserved with some black near edges.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by City Art Gallery and Museum, Bristol. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Sherd is only labelled as H2016 and shares the same accession number with several other unrelated sherds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.294)
